page.title: 08Settlements-Hewshott
page.content: { Hewshott}is a very small settlement situated along a small winding country lane between{Hammer Bottom}and {Liphook.}The majority of houses are old with large grounds, but others are modern. The occupants are mostly elderly and retired. The village is dominated by Hewshott House, it is rather large and has two flats attached.The flats were below the standards of the rest of the village. The grounds are quite large and have many large trees. There is a riding school but some houses have their own horses and stables. There is also a small estate which has some quite modern houses. Some of the fields along Hewshott Lane were planted with cereals whilst others were just rough grassland. Penally Farm has horses, cows and several old barns. There are no shops
